issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The fact that multiple threads sharing the same metastore client which is used for RPC to Thrift is not thread safe.

Race condition can happen when one sees "out of sequence response" error message from Thrift server. That means the response from the Thrift server is for a different request (by a different thread).

Solution will be to synchronize methods from the client side.
fields.summary: Make metastore client thread safe in DbTxnManager

comments.body: Upload patch 1. [~ekoifman] Can you review please?
Previous patch has wrong name. Corrected it.
[~wzheng] Is there a need to expose the underlying IMetaStoreClient object via SynchronizedMetaStoreClient?
Right, I should have removed that getter. Thanks for catching that.
+1 pending tests. I would probably make the IMetaStoreClient member within the SynchronizedMetaStoreClient a final too.
Makes sense. Patch 3 made that field client final. Thanks [~vgumashta] for the review!

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12803771/HIVE-13753.3.patch

{color:red}ERROR:{color} -1 due to build exiting with an error
